_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The underlying tendencies to be given up: The underlying tendency to greed should be given up when it comes to pleasant feeling
The underlying tendency to repulsion should be given up when it comes to painful feeling
The underlying tendency to ignorance should be given up when it comes to neutral feeling
The qualities of a mendicant without und: They have made an end of suffering
The consequences of not understanding fe: The underlying tendency to greed is there when you feel pleasure without understanding feeling, if you don’t see the escape
The underlying tendency to repulsion is there when you feel pain without understanding feeling, if you don’t see the escape
The importance of understanding neutral: If you relish it, you’re still not released from suffering
The qualities of an astute person (a cau: They do not neglect situational awareness
The qualities of a knowledge master [sn3: They are without defilements in this very life
When their body breaks up, they can’t be reckoned.
